93930.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dsupa","text":"Prepare stain-free gels in advance  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7irab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"415E7CF1289B451E9A046F90F70485AA","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"4–20% gradient mini-PROTEAN TGX stain-free gel","rrid":"","sku":"4568085","url":"http://","vendor":{"id":41,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://www.bio-rad.com/","name":"Bio-Rad Laboratories"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3j3g","text":" Before starting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ifo7","text":"a.       Prepare samples, loading order,  and antibodies/concentrations [save to excel sheet]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fnc1","text":"Prepare buffers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck8oj","text":"1x running buffer,       ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45pcm","text":"1x TBST,   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mis1","text":"Transfer buffer (let cool in 4C while gel runs!)—Need around 1L for 2 gels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmp94","text":"200ml meOH      100ml 10x transfer buffer       700ml ddH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6opjh","text":"      Prepare gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qoa1","text":"Use 4-20% gel with 10/12/15 well comb (cold room)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vf4r","text":"Open package, remove sticker from bottom","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t557","text":"Insert gel into cassette  and close sides (if only running one gel add additional side filler)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0t60","text":"Fill inside of cassette with running buffer—make sure no leaks!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dsi0","text":"Gently pull out comb","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ck88m","text":"      Loading samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"367pa","text":"Loading Samples:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7qpn","text":"Outline loading order and save to data drive","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tooh","text":"Load protein ladder (5ul) for each gel ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs0o","text":"Optional: add 100pg recomb. synuclein","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49va0","text":"(1ul of stock 100pg/ul a-synuclein + Laemmli buffer in 10% DTT (fresh))","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45o3e","text":"Add 10ul to well","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ngqs","text":"Load 10ul to each well","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0m7m","text":"If not first time, calculate amount of sample if previously run (based off of synuclein total load)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agfrt","text":"Vortex sample tube very well before loading","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7loj","text":"Pipette slowly ensuring correct amounts are loaded","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66ptq","text":"Avoid the gunk","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fne6","text":"      Run Gel and Set Up Transfer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t5jd","text":"90V for ~45min-1hr ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q5pg","text":"Once loading dye reaches the bottom of the gel stop it","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgifa","text":"Soak the 0.2 um nitrocellulose membrane   in MeOH for at least 2 min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b22c3","text":"Dump out the running buffer in the sink rinse the tank and cassettes with ddH2O","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1it42","text":"Fill tank up half way with transfer buffer to prevent drying out","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17hbe","text":"Move the membrane to transfer buffer once ready to put together","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g4tc","text":"Order of stacking:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0g5p","text":"Black side of cassette down","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9fku","text":"Soak sponges with transfer buffer and place at bottom edge of black cassette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uj1o","text":"Soak one filter paper in transfer buffer and lay on sponge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cmb3","text":"Open gel carefully using wet spatula and cut the bottom and wells off gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbkrt","text":"Orient the top of the gel (well 1 on top left) at the ‘bottom’ of the cassette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29kpm","text":"Lay the nitrocellulose membrane on top of the gel make sure flat, avoid bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nb10","text":"Add another filter paper on top of nitrocellulose membrane","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqjnq","text":"Put sponge on top and roll out the bubbles gently","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a84l","text":"Sandwich cassette closed and place in tank with Transfer buffer full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t497","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t1dh","text":"Check orientation of the cassette is black-black, red-red","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsdrv","text":"Add ice pack to each tank (that is why only one cassette per tank)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c4p7","text":"Fill Transfer buffer to the top of the cassettes to make sure the membrane does not dry out. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"diu2j","text":"Run overnight at 4C deli fridge, 30V","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cas_number":"","group_reagent":{},"guid":"26AD0E5F468043219388D18A0C3BB4D5","id":"","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Nitrocellulose Membrane, Roll, 0.2 um","rrid":"","sku":"1620112","url":"http://","vendor":{"id":41,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://www.bio-rad.com/","name":"Bio-Rad Laboratories"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cakn","text":"      Stop Transfer, Block and Add Primary Antibody ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6f130","text":"Prepare blocking buffer (5% milk in 1x TBST)—always block in milk ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6jagb","text":"Remove tank from 4C and dump out transfer buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90f1t","text":"Prepare tray for membranes (know which regions of the gel needed to cut) and label box","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7nstt","text":"Remove cassettes and take off the sponge and filter paper","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mlkr","text":"Prepare a container with TBST and use forceps to move the membrane from the gel to the TBST (make sure submerged)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5f00i","text":"Cut the membrane in the desired location based on the protein ladder and put in tray with TBST covering the membrane","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l8rt","text":"After washes with TBST, add 5ml of blocking buffer to each membrane section ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qn3j","text":"Block at room temp while rotating for 30minutes to 1 hour","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a8rj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ec2p","text":"In the meantime prepare/calculate antibody concentrations (update info on WB excel sheet)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gmpb","text":"After blocking, add antibody directly to corresponding membrane and put at 4C overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bsuh6","text":"Place at 4C on shaker overnight ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6qj1q","text":"Wash 3x 5min TBST","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"rgat","text":"      Wash and Add Secondary ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6a35p","text":"Dump out primary antibody solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d29ju","text":"Wash blots 3x 5 min with TBST, with gentle rotation at room temp","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cgucp","text":"Make fresh milk (5% in TBST) for secondary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fe900","text":"Add secondary to blot, place in 4C rocking overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp3an","text":" Image Blot on BioRad Chemidoc","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qi9v","text":"Quantify Blot","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qbtn","text":"a.       Crop \u0026 Autoscale","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8v360","text":"b.      Lane \u0026 Band:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30jfd","text":"i.      Lane: manual, input number of lanes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fi7rq","text":"ii.      Adjust lanes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0631","text":"c.       Bands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28vj7","text":"i.      Detect bands","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak480","text":"d.      Quantity tool","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l4ni","text":"i.      Select relative (WT)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m0va","text":"ii.      Click analysis table for all relative band values","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cms0","text":"e.       Export table","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bdvde","text":"The protocol describes step-by-step instructions on how to set a sedimentation assay to monitor the aggregation of alpha-synuclein over time. The protocol allows for precise quantification of fibril formation kinetics using SDS-PAGE. This methodology enhances our understanding of the underlying mechanisms involved in protein misfolding and offers a reliable tool for investigating potential therapeutic interventions targeting alpha-synuclein aggregation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_equipments.name: Omega - RT-QuIC / PRION Version - Fluorescence Base

BioSpec Products 2.3 mm Zirconia/Silica Beads 1 lb bottle
PCR Plate Heat Seal foil piercable
4–20% Mini-PROTEAN® TGX Stain-Free™ Protein Gels, 15 well, 15 µl
Amicon Ultra-0.5 Centrifugal Filter Unit 24 pack

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a00jh","text":"Thaw down a-syn monomer and/or sonicated fibril aliquots. Use water-bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnj2p","text":"Do not generate bubbles by pipetting or shaking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tlrf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33mpg","text":"Calculate the volume of monomer need following:  0.3 mg/mL of monomer in a reaction (30 ul reaction/well). {"blocks":[{"key":"coad9","text":"Centrifuge at 20,000g for 10 min at 10C, collect 90 uL (the pellet should be visible). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmbss","text":"Add 4x Laemmli sample buffer to the collected reactions and freeze the samples untill further application ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ceim","text":"Transfer the 50 ul of supernatant into a new epperdorf tube, remove soluble fraction from the centrifuged pellets and add 90 ul of fresh PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5g61j","text":"Stop the gel and cover it with 100mL of the fixing solution (50% Methanol, 10% Acetic acid) for 30 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqp91","text":"Stain the gel for 1 hr at room temperature with 100 mL of Coomassie stain (0.4g of Coomassie blue   in 200 mL of 40% Methanol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2hm5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4108CB2C341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":825.98,"name":"10g Coomassie Brilliant Blue R-250 Dye","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"786-495","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.gbiosciences.com/BTSNM-Support-Materials\r","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://www.gbiosciences.com/","name":"G-Biosciences"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajjek","text":"Destain the gel using washing solution consisting of 10% Acetic acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: α-Synuclein sedimentation assay
warning:
{"blocks":[{"key":"20qtn","text":"Hazard Identification and Risk of Exposure to the
Hazards:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72oss","text":"Inhalation or spread through food or drink that contain fibrils aerosols or fibrils.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ar0a","text":"Protective gloves, safety glasses and lab coat must always be used when handling anything that possibly could contain α-synuclein fibrils. Food or drink is strictly prohibited in any environment where α-syn fibrils are used. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4prl3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdoc3","text":"Routes of Transmission: Prior to assigning containment requirements, it is imperative to
understand the routes of transmission. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":127,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":103},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":24,"length":104}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2euo","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8222k","text":"Some issues to address:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cq3h","text":"     What are the exposure routes/risks of most concern:","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":5,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0lht","text":"Inhalation or spread through food or drink that contain fibril aerosols or fibirls accordingly. Fibrils possibly might reach the brain regions through the olfactory epithelium; Risk of accidental needlestick/droplet splash while handling fibrils for in vitro or in vivo work.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":250,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":262,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpc5f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84bl4","text":"     What are the consequences of exposure (potential illness, etc) ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":5,"length":62},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":5,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5rkr","text":"Fibrils may be considered as infectious material. Minimum to no hazard is expected from α-syn protein. There is no evidence that transmission of fibrils can lead to development Parkinson’s disease. However, taking into account prion-like properties of α-syn fibrils should therefore be handled cautiously and wisely. Strictly recommended using disposable materials and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) such as gloves, face mask, etc. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":103,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25d3u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qid0","text":"PRECAUTIONS:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el4i","text":"Laboratory work where high concentration of fibrils (more than 300 uM) is needed must comply with biosafety level 2 (BSL2) containment as described in the current edition of the CDC/NIH’s
Biosafety in the Microbiological and Biomedical Laboratories: http://www.cdc.gov/od/ohs/biosfty/bmbl5/bmbl5toc.htm","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":250},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":302}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":250,"length":52}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kfcp","text":"Sharps safety precautions:
The use of sharps (glass pipettes, glass slides and cover slips, scalpels and
lancets) should be eliminated, when possible. Appropriate precautions should be
taken to avoid percutaneous injuries. These items should be disposed of
immediately in a puncture-resistant sharps container. Bending, recapping or
clipping of needles is prohibited. As described in CDC’s sharps safety website:
https://www.cdc.gov/sharpssafety/index.html","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":413,"length":43}],"data":{}},{"key":"nhv9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4v5f","text":"Procedural Methods
and Materials: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70vp6","text":"     Laboratory work where high concentration of fibrils (more than 300 uM) is needed must comply with biosafety level 2 (BSL2) containment. This means all aerosol generating procedures must be performed within the biosafety cabinet.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j0t0","text":"      All the fibrils work involves using PPE, aerosol-tight centrifuges, water
bath sonicator in a closed cabinet, homogenization of frozen brain samples
using probe-tip sonicator under the hood (collection of protein fractions in
BSL2 cabinets), chromatography equipment in a closed-door fridge, sealed
plates, safe lock microfuge tubes (or tubes wrapped/sealed with parafilm), and use
of filtered tips for pipettes. All personnel must strictly adhere to these
procedures.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":468}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oqtn","text":"      Use of proper PPE as stated in the section below. Use of available N95 respirators is voluntary (same for the use of available sleeve protectors). Follow safety precautions for sharps (for e.g., to avoid accidental needle sticks) while working with PFFs in the lab and for doing in
vivo work.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":285,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5enp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bo56l","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsi8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72pcc","text":"Personal Protective
Equipment (PPE): Appropriate PPE includes gloves, lab coat and safety glasses,
face mask (voluntary N95 respirator use and sleeve protectors), face / bench
top splash shield for specific procedures as stated above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dr33v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpboa","text":"Methods to minimize personal exposure: Strictly adhere to sharps safety precautions using needles or any material that can potentially cause wounds. Use disposable supplies where possible. Use the minimal amounts of α-fibrils needed for an experiment. Keep fibrils in closed tubes. 10% of SDS solution in water must be used for decontaminating work areas. Do not use NaOH or Sodium Hypochlorite or ethanol. Do not leave samples containing fibrils unattended at the bench. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lcon","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rjeh","text":"Methods to prevent the release of fibrils/protect workers from aerosols,
splashes, splatters: protective gloves and clothing always be always be worn when handling frozen vials. High concentration of fibrils(>1mg/mL) always be handled under Biosafety cabinet and containment caps will be used while centrifugation. Centrifuge cups will be opened inside a biosafety cabinet. Face shield or benchtop splash shield will be used when working at the open bench.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":92}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62qe2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"842eb","text":"Specimen transport
and removal of material(s) from the laboratory: Transported in secondary
container (plastic/Styrofoam) in a closed box. The closed box is carried in a
bag.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eefm6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r0bl","text":"Standard
microbiological methods: hand washing after removal of gloves and before
leaving the work area, no mouth pipetting, strictly no food or drink in
refrigerators where material is stored, no eating in work area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1632b","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"625d5","text":"Cleaning &
Disinfection: Work area must be
cleaned with 10% SDS in water. Wipes used must be immediately disposed into
biohazard waste container. Any piece of equipment or supplies that possibly
have been exposed to fibrils must be wiped with 10% of SDS.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":56,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ov5c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6vgk","text":"Waste Generation and Disposal Methods: The solutions that contain α-syn fibrils must be
decontaminated with 10% of SDS in water for 30 minutes and be thrown as a
biohazard waste in a sealed container/bag (use a minimal volume of fibrils needed
for an experiment, do not generate large volumes of fibril-containing liquids).
Use small biohazard bags to collect tips and consumables of experiment
performed, appropriately tie neck of bag in single knot and place in into
secondary biohazard waste container. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p3kc","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bldn","text":"Spill and Accident Response Procedure: Describe all emergency procedures including spill clean-up. Describedisinfectants and
environmental decontamination. (ex., Outside of a BSC: If spill is a
respiratory hazard, evacuate 30 minutes to allow aerosols to settle. Place absorbent towels over the spill, apply freshly
prepared 10% SDS solution to entire area of spill starting on the outer edges
and working inward, pick up sharp items with mechanical device (not hands),
place all clean-up materials in a biohazard bag)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":117}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D2279DCFC08E11EE919A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.cdc.gov/od/ohs/biosfty/bmbl5/bmbl5toc.htm"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D2279DCFC08E11EE919A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.cdc.gov/sharpssafety/index.html"}}}}
